alert.note: Alert for East Turnagain Arm (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 10 at 4:35PM AKST until December 11 at 6:00AM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM AKST MONDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow and blowing snow occurring. Visibility one quarter mile or less at times. Total snow accumulations of 15 to 30 inches, with local amounts up to 35 inches possible. East winds gusting as high as 60 mph, strongest through Portage Valley. * WHERE...East Turnagain Arm. * WHEN...Until 6 AM AKST Monday. * IMPACTS...Travel will be difficult. Heavy snow and blowing snow will lead to white-out conditions at times. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Gusty winds will strengthen this evening and peak overnight tonight. The heaviest snow will be this evening through early Monday morning. Snow will mix with or change to rain at sea level early Monday morning, which will affect the storm total snow accumulation.
info.instruction: A Winter Storm Warning for snow means severe winter weather conditions will make travel very hazardous. If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.
